modals.notesUn: For simplification, donors were limited to the 30 highest contributors to UN organizations. Therefore, some donors may not be displayed. UN System Donors are added in the table and network view, but will not show up here unless there part of those 30 contributors.
modals.noBudgetDisclosed: No detailed budget amount is publicly disclosed.
modals.notesProjectDonors: Project donor countries may differ from organization-level donor countries.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.subtitle: Understand how our data was collected and how to use it best for your research
methodology.sourceIdentificationDescription: We aggregate data from a curated set of public and partner sources, including international organizations, government portals, and open data repositories relevant to crisis funding and humanitarian response.
methodology.automatedManualGatheringDescription: Data is collected through a combination of automated pipelines (APIs, web scraping) and manual curation to ensure completeness and accuracy.
methodology.regularUpdatesDescription: The dataset is refreshed periodically to capture new funding flows, projects, and organizational changes.
methodology.entityMappingDescription: Organizations, donors, and projects are mapped to unique identifiers to avoid duplication and enable cross-referencing.
methodology.investmentTypingDescription: Each project is classified into one or more investment types based on project descriptions and metadata:
methodology.themeTaggingDescription: Projects are tagged with thematic areas (e.g., health, displacement, food security) using keyword analysis and expert review.
methodology.clickOnInvestmentType: Click on an investment type to explore
methodology.dataGapsDescription: Not all funding flows or projects are publicly reported; some data may be incomplete or delayed.
methodology.classificationSubjectivityDescription: Investment type and theme assignments may involve interpretation, especially for multi-sector projects.
methodology.simplificationDescription: For clarity, some visualizations (e.g., UN donor lists) are simplified and do not reflect the full complexity of funding relationships.
methodology.searchLogicDescription: Search operates on project titles and organization names.
methodology.donorFilterDescription: Multiple donors trigger a conjunction. Returned projects must be co-financed by every selected donor.
methodology.typeFilterDescription: Multiple types trigger a disjunction. Organizations appear if any of their projects match at least one selected type.
methodology.themeFilterDescription: Multiple themes trigger a disjunction. Projects appear if they match at least one of the selected themes.
methodology.typeThemeRelationshipDescription: Themes are nested under types. Selecting a type restricts theme options to those linked to that type. Themes from other types can still surface when projects span multiple types and carry overlapping themes.
methodology.donorFilterQuestion: Check: Does org have ALL selected donors?
methodology.searchFilterQuestion: Check: Does org name match search?
methodology.searchFilterYesHint: Then filter by Type/Theme if selected
methodology.searchFilterNoHint: Go to Step 3 for project-level filtering
methodology.mustMatchForProjectVisible: Must match for project to be visible
methodology.hasVisibleProject: AND has ≥1 visible project after filtering
methodology.orgNameMatches: OR org name matches search (shows all projects)
methodology.hasZeroVisibleProjects: OR has 0 visible projects after filtering
methodology.graphStructureDescription: The network view displays the filtered dataset as an undirected graph, showing relationships between donors, organizations, and projects.
methodology.clusteringOptionsDescription: Clustering options aggregate projects and organizations by type, making it easier to identify patterns and connections within specific investment categories.
methodology.interactiveNodesDescription: Project and organization nodes are interactive and open a detail modal when clicked, providing in-depth information about entities and their relationships.
methodology.spatialInterpretationDescription: Spatial proximity in the graph has no geographic or ideological meaning. Node positions are determined by the force-directed layout algorithm to optimize visualization clarity.
methodology.csvExportDescription: Exports two CSV files (organization table and product table) in a ZIP archive. Organizations CSV includes names, types, descriptions, and funding sources. Products CSV includes names, associated organizations, types, themes, donors, descriptions, and website.
methodology.excelExportDescription: Export the same data as a professionally formatted Excel workbook. Includes organizations and products sheets with styling and optimized column widths. Includes a README file with export metadata and current filter details.
methodology.sharingAndReproducibilityDescription: All exports respect your current filters (donors, investment types, themes, search query). The metadata and README file includes information about which filters were applied. Also, when sharing a link to the app, the same filters will be pre-applied for recipients, as the filter criteria are denoted in the URL.
methodology.feedbackSubtitle: We welcome your input to improve our methodology and data quality.
